definition: plait/braid/pigtail/a mistake or shortcoming that may be exploited by an opponent/handle/CL:根[gen1],條|条[tiao2]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others
to grab sb by the pigtail/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings
to grab sb by the queue (i.e. hair)/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings

sentences.english: Two plaits fall over her shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 两条辫子垂在她的肩上。

sentences.english: Braid each side, the lumpier the better.
sentences.chinese: 把每边，越多块编成辫子好。

sentences.english: He leered at the girl in pigtails.
sentences.chinese: 他色迷迷的斜眼看着梳辫子的姑娘。

sentences.english: She wore her hair in plaits.
Some people thought thieves were plaiting the manes of horses they wished to steal.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为这些辫子是小偷为日后行窃编的。

sentences.english: In came a little girl, wearing a white skirt with long hair.
sentences.chinese: 进来了一个小姑娘，梳着长辫子，穿白色裙子。

sentences.english: Neytiri takes the end of her queue and raises it.
sentences.chinese: 奈提莉用手轻握她辫子的末端，将它抬起。

sentences.english: However, to the hair braids Zhaqi tilted very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 但是扎起辫子来头发翘着很美观。

sentences.english: And the braided neckline is a nice detail too.
sentences.chinese: 并且辫子形的领圈也是一个精致的细节。

sentences.english: She wears her hair in a braid.
The dough-twist style plaits are a symbol of Uygur girls.
sentences.chinese: 麻花辫子几乎是维吾尔族姑娘的象征了。

sentences.english: The nuance of natural strands become from curls that cascade to braids that beguile.
sentences.chinese: 天然丝的细微差别从级联到欺骗辫子卷发成了。

sentences.english: I hope to see my grandchildren in Australia before I turn up my toes .
sentences.chinese: 我希望在我翘辫子之前去澳大利亚看看我的孙子。

sentences.english: Two black plaits hung down her back.
sentences.chinese: 她两根乌黑的辫子垂在背上。

sentences.english: I painted a girl with a pigtail.
sentences.chinese: 我画了一位梳辫子的姑娘。

definition: pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others
Mawei district of Fuzhou city 福州市[Fu2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)
erhua variant of 小辮|小辫[xiao3 bian4]
hair worn in a bun or coil
